Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2008 10:08AM shend wrote: Hi Sunny, Sometimes if you  take some medicine with empty stomack, it will cause heartburn. Try to eat some soup and food, see if  the heartburn will go away.  I hope you feel better soon and pray for you. Shen
Posts.Title: Now what?? sunny365 Irina

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2008 04:44PM shend wrote: Hi Deb, I read your post. Here is what I experienced in the past three months: I had been on Taxol +Avastin, Zometa since Oct, 2007 to May 2008. It made me bone mets stable and live mets gone that did not show up on PET/CT scan after 9 treatment. I started had blured vision since Jan, but that time checked with eye doc, said dry eyes , everyone thought chemo was the cause, I even posted  here. People responed with the same. But in the middle of April, the vision getting worse, barely can read from computer, watch TV and traffic signs. Then I had  headache, nausea, and vomiting for several weeks and I lost 12 lbs. in 4 weeks. I had a brain MRI on May 28, 2008 and was diagonosed with leptomeningeal metastases, and there were cancer cells in my cerebrospinal fluid. Since then  in the middle of May I stopped the Taxol, May 30, 2008- June, 10, 2008 - I had 10 sessions brain radiation at Brigham and Women's. May 30, 2008 - I was in ER due to severe headache after radiation. June 26-27, 2008 - I had neurosurgery to install a port for chemo treatment in my head. The surgeon digged a hole on my skull and inserted a port in. June 27, 2008 - I was in ER due to seizure. July 3-4, 2008 - I had a failed neurosurgery to take the port out. Oncologist could not access the port and inject the chemo drug. July 10-12 2008 - I had the third neurosurgery to put a new port in and had a brain chemo treatment on July 11, 2008. July 29, 2008 - I had second brain chemo treatment through the port, scheduled to have more brain chemo every two weeks. Also the Onc put me on Arimidex now too. Yes, the Onc told me I had very poor progonosis. but no one can tell us which day we will die. It is really hard to survive from this, I felt I seem die once and be alive again. The good thing is my vision was back to normal 6 weeks ago. no headache, nausa, vomiting. Hang in there.  Shend
Posts.Title: OK...the docs have a plan. AlaskaDeb LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 01:14PM shend wrote: Hi Joni, Sorry to hear your news. It is O.K and normal to feel sad, angry, scared. Most of us have the same experience. Since you still have two weeks to see you doctor, maybe when you feel a little better, just make a list what chemo/hormonal drugs you used and all you tumor marker test result and do some research on yourself, get prepared... It is very hard on the transition time to change treatment. Hang on there. Shen

Posts.Title: Morphine all day everyday - Things are getting serious TripleNeg lewisfamily503

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2008 09:51PM shend wrote: Just vent here, I have live and extensive bone mets back to oct 07 i started chemo Taxol + Avastin in Oct.8 07. In the week of my second treatment, I could not get sleep and had a lot of pain, my sister kept calling me and said " you should go out  and take a walk, etc". Seems that if I walk three miles a day, my cancer will be gone...or my life style is wrong. Just put so much stress on me, then my white count dropped, I could not get the third week treatment followed by sore throat, mouth sore....I had to tell her, don't call me, I call you....I know she cares about me, just people don't know how chemo can knock you down. I need afternoon nap and I might have good days, I also have days to have hard time to get up. I used to take all the pain and hardship to myself and endure, then I found out I treat myself too hard. I was kind of living in double  life. I am a human being and I have no difference from others. It is not a shame to admit I need more rest and I am suffering rather than put a happy face in front of others. Also in Oct, and Nov, my superviser called me every other week.   All he cares about when I finish my treatment and go back to work. The most mean thing is  he called me on Friday evening and said "I worked late today....." I felt he wanted me to feel guilty to take short trem disability and be home. Then one Friday night I did not pick up his phone call and replied him an email and told him what side affect I am dealing with, then after Thankgiving, he did not call me anymore. I know now he thinks I am a goner now, no longer useful for him. I do have a couple of good friends and really cares me and my husband is fine, I tried to keep myself away from people who might hurt me. Dealing with cancer is not easy. How could they know how hard we put ourself togather after failed treatment or had bad scan results. How could they know how many bleeding scars in our heart when we are on the cancer journey. Thank you for listening
Posts.Title: Disappointed in people Jackson susan320

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2008 04:10PM shend wrote: Robin, So sorry to hear it. Please don't give up and there are still options. Shen
Posts.Title: To coin a phrase from Watson... taxol crapall RobinWendy Maya1

Posts.Content: shend wrote: Hi, Just want to share with you. I am still a little disbelieve that. I did PET and CT scan at the end of Sept, 07 and scan results told me I have early liver mets and at least 2 small spots on liver( did not tell me the size from the report). Then I am in chemo Taxol +Avastin since Oct.8. so far I did 9 treatments. Last week did PET/CT at Dana Farber. They did not find any spots in the liver now. So it is a good news for me, the scan can not detect it and the treatment is working!!! Now I will stay in the same treatment and deal with my bone mets  only. This year I failed Tamoxifen, Aromasin and Xeloda. None of them stopped the cancer progression. Finally got something works for me.  Shen  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scan results with a good news shend debstitchestoo

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2008 10:54PM shend wrote: LuAnn, I am in Boston and treated in Dana Farber and Bringham& women hospital.  Most of doctor especialy in ER, they are lacking experience. I should be on decordon for five days 8 mg after I got treatment, then stopped it, in ER I told the doc the headache might caused by it, After the ER I got treatment, on decodon again, the pain did not stop, so it is not by the decordon dose. The headache happened when I changed my postion, from sit to stand, such as get out the car. that time i even no clue about the spinal headache. I also have bone pain- tail bone pain. I am feeling I am a rotten apple, 41 years old with physical condition like 80 years old....sigh....my son just started kindergarden today, i am not capable to drive and walk to pick him up , school is only 0.46 mile from home. I am disappointed with the medical professionals. My oncologist was just back to work from maternity leave. The one who covered her, once telling me i can choose no treatmnet with leptomeningeal metastases after they failed to put the port in head. They did it three times.
Posts.Title: Anyone on Doxil, need information shend PineHouse

Posts.Content: shend wrote: hi, Finished three cycles of Xeloda+ Avastin, my turmor marker did not drop. Scheduled scans at the last week of Oct.  But due to the tumor marker value, doctor moved the scan to next week.  So high likely Xeloda did not work for me. I was very upset to hear the blood test result yesterday. Plan to see dr. on Oct.1 , do not know what 's my next drug will be. Xeloda is my first chemo drug. I tolerated very well, besides fatigue, no other side affect.  I only has one Flasdox , since the mets is very aggressive now. So it will be chemo....I wish i have some good news to share....just failure following another one... Thank you for listening. Shen Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Xeloda might not work for me shend katie11

Posts.Content: shend wrote: Hi, I am very upset  today. In the past three months I was told that I am in very serious condition and only months to live twice. I feel so low.....  . From May I was fighting with leptomeningeal metastases. Now it is under control, the Brain MRI clear and they can not find cancer cell in the fluid although I am suffering from spinal haedache attack.for three weeks.  My liver mets was NED after 9 Taxol+ Avastin treatment, last week just did PET/CT scan, it is getting much worse now, too many to count, today the doc said to start Doxil on this Thursday, she said that I should see if it is working in two months. If it is not working, this will be pretty much my end. Although some drugs I have not tried yet,  by that time my liver could not handle it. If you are taking Doxil, please give me some tips and hopes. Thanks Shen  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2008 02:30AM shend wrote: Hi Susan, I dx with Bone mets in Sept, 05, then liver mets in Oct, 07, after 8 treatment Taxol +Avastin, PET scan showed liver mets gone, then did scan last week, no liver mets. Please don't scared, Taxol/Carbo combo is a strong one, ask you doc if you can use Avastin which is not a chemo drug, but it cut off the blood supply to tumor. Taxol +Avastin recently was approved by FDA. Good luck to your treatment. Hang on there Shen
Posts.Title: Today Liver Mets Confirmed SunshineSmiles SunshineSmiles

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2008 02:26PM shend wrote: I was diagnosed with leptomeningeal metastates at the end of May. Then immeadiately did 10 sessions whole brain radiation. After that I had three nuro surgeries to get the Omaya port in my head. so doc can inject Chemo drug through the port. It was a tough time. I was told they can not do too much, only months left. I can choose no treatment. Anyway I did not give up since I am only 41 with two kids. At the end of Aug, I did head MRI that showed No evidence of disease. Since I also have extensive bone and liver mets, so in Sept I started chemo Doxil. Most of cases, vomiting, lost appitite, headache, lost balance related with something wrong in brain. Only 2-5% people have leptomeningeal metastates. I think the doc took action ( order MRI)  late. I am very sorry to hear your SIL  and pray for peace and comfort for her.

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 03:34AM shend wrote: Hi Diane, Last year my bone mets took a bad turn and progressed very fast, I tried 2 months Xeloda which did not work, then found liver mets too, then switch to Taxol +Avastin. I have been on it for 6 months now, had 20 treatments so far. the pain went away and bone mets stable, and liver mets did not showed on PET/Ct scan after 9 treatment. Now I am think if I did not do Xeloda, leave it as a maintenance drug for later, it might be a better choice, it can give me a break from Chemo although Xeloda is a chemo drug. Since I have very extensive  bone mets now, I feel my doc will not take me off from chemo as long as it works. Chemo is chemo, it has a lot side effects I have to deal with. I hope some day I can stable enough or NED and  take a break from chemo. Good luck to you. You have  a lot of options. Hugs Shen

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2007 11:34AM shend wrote: I agree with bugs and member of the club. This is the second time Toto said something wrong. a couple week ago I posted a topic "mouth sore" and here is her reply: "Avastin is good but  (TAXOL ) the devil that poision you but do not kill ur cancer,did you read the news about taxol 2 weeks ago,it does not work for most BC patients! like ER+ PR+ and positive lymphnode! go to another oncol.because your oncology is very old fashion." First she made a conclusion my treatment is not working, did  know my case at all, thend said my doctors are old fashion. In fact I am treated at Memorial Sloan( Top1) and Dana Farber( top 5). I have been on this board for 2.5 years. No one like the way Toto behaved.  On this board we help, encourage and share information together.  Somtimes we can not offer any help, but we showed our comparssion. We are not stupid and we don't anyone to make dicision or conclusion for us. Shen
Posts.Title: CA 27.29 Saffire Buzz

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 01:40PM shend wrote: Hi, I have been doing Taxol +Avastin( three weeks on, one week off) for five months now. The first two treatment, I was given premedication Decadron and Zantac pills and took them before treatment. I was told if you don't allergic in the first two treatments, then you will be fine in the rest treatments.  Right now I just have strange taste when I was pumping into taxol. Please noteI was given the benadryl before I got the Taxol.  So when I am getting Taxol, I am in a kind of sleeping mode. There are certain orders of the drugs they need to give to you( oral or IV), before you get Taxol. Double check them. We suppose to trust the chemo nurses, but we also need to keep an eye to ourself to protect ourself.

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2008 12:06PM shend wrote: Hi Deb, I am feeling your pain. It took three surgeries to get my port works. After the first surgeries, evrerything looked good, but after I just laid down on my bed at home, I had a seisure...then back to ER again. The Docs lack experience to treat us since there are not many case like us. I was also overdosed Docordron for three weeks....who knows how those drugs interact with each other. The more drugs they give to us, the more SE we suffer, I also put on the Arimidex for 5 weeks, just stopped it and started Doxil, since they stopped chemo taxol+avastin, my liver is getting much worse just in two months. Four weeks ago I had double vision( lasted 3-5 mins) and headache after I change my position( sit to stand). I think it related to Arimidex. but docs have no clues about it. The ER doc said we gave you some pain medicine...Anyway, very disappointed. I want to know why it happened. Hang in there. I will pray for you. Shen
